snippet: The Syrian government said it was following a special envoy’s cease-fire plan, but the leader of the United Nations said the conflict was getting worse.
abstract: Spasms of fighting continue to convulse parts of Syria, with clashes reported only miles from Damascus; United Nations leader Kofi Annan says conflict is getting worse, contradicting the Syrian government's assurances that it is complying with special envoy’s cease-fire plan.

byline.original: By ANNE BARNARD and RICK GLADSTONE
byline.contributor: Anne Barnard reported from Beirut, and Rick Gladstone from New York. Alan Cowell contributed reporting from London, and Hwaida Saad from Beirut.

lead_paragraph: The Syrian government said it was following a special envoy’s cease-fire plan, but the leader of the United Nations said the conflict was getting worse.

headline.seo: Syrians Battle Near Damascus as Skepticism Grows About Assad Promises
headline.main: New Clashes Fuel U.N. Skepticism of Promises by Syria
headline.print_headline: New Clashes Across Syria Fuel U.N. Skepticism of Government’s Promises

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
keywords.name: subject
